definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: A gymnast on the trampoline was turning somersaults.
sentences.chinese: 有個體操運動員正在蹦牀上做空翻。

sentences.english: But he fell when he tried the back flip.
sentences.chinese: 可是他試著要後空翻的時候卻跌倒了。

sentences.english: Forward piked salto mount to stand on beam is a new creation of "E" part.
sentences.chinese: “平衡木屈體前空翻站木”是E組創新動作。

sentences.english: A few of us( A few of the students ) in our class can do a somersault.
sentences.chinese: 我們班裏只有幾個人會作側空翻。

sentences.english: She just completed a double back somersault!
sentences.chinese: 她剛剛完成了兩個後空翻的動作。

sentences.english: Can I do a quadruple back flip?
Then , he runs back the other way and dose a somersault in the air , only this time against the motion of the train.
sentences.chinese: 然後他會逆着車行駛的方向奔跑，再來一個空翻。

sentences.english: You know that Klose is has the best somersaults and he deserves some kind of award for this.
sentences.chinese: 你覺得克洛澤的空翻真棒，甚至應該收到獎勵。

sentences.english: The judges were very impressed with the snowboarder's amazing flips .
sentences.chinese: 裁判員們對滑雪運動員驚人的空翻留下深刻印象。

sentences.english: A Back Flip is definitely one of the most difficult tricks to perform.
sentences.chinese: 後空翻絕對是滑雪花式裏面難度最大的一個動作。

sentences.english: BI do back flips at the pool all the time.
sentences.chinese: 在游泳池我一直都會後空翻。

sentences.english: In performing the Backflip Mute Grab, you need speed and more rotation.
sentences.chinese: 進行後空翻默抓時，需要速度和更多的旋轉。

sentences.english: He backflipped off a bucking horse.
sentences.chinese: 他從一匹猛然弓背躍起的馬上後空翻落下。

sentences.english: The side somersault is a stunt in three circuits to bunch up the body.
sentences.chinese: 團身側空翻三週是一個高難度動作。

sentences.english: The player skated a backflip on the ice.
sentences.chinese: 運動員在冰面上作了個後空翻。

definition: to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
the splits (move in dancing)/to do the splits/Taiwan pr. [pi3 cha1]
to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
(gymnastics) to do a bridge/to do a crab
to roll over/to turn over (one's body)
a handstand/to turn upside down/to stand on one's head/upside down
